Package gov.nasa.larcfm.IO

Class FileUtil

java.lang.Object
gov.nasa.larcfm.IO.FileUtil
public final class FileUtil extends Object
A collection of utility functions useful for files

    • get_path

      public static String get_path(String filename)
      Given a file name, return the path of this name. This also converts backward slashes to forward slashes.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file
      Returns:
      the path of the file, if no path, then an empty string is returned.

    • get_extension

      public static String get_extension(String filename)
      Given a file name return the extension of this name.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file
      Returns:
      the extension--part of filename after last period (.)

    • unifyFileName

      public static String unifyFileName(String filename)
      Given a file name return the Java version of this name. This converts backward slashes to forward slashes.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file
      Returns:
      the Java-native version of the filename

    • no_path

      public static String no_path(String filename)
      Returns the base (no path) file name.
      • a/b/c.txt = c.txt
      • a.txt = a.txt
      • a/b/ = ""
      This also converts backward slashes to forward slashes.
      Parameters:
      filename - filename string
      Returns:
      filename without path information

    • no_extension

      public static String no_extension(String filename)
      Returns the file name without an extension (such as, ".txt"). Also removes path information.
      Parameters:
      filename - filename string
      Returns:
      filename without extension information

    • absolute_path

      public static String absolute_path(String src, String targ)
      Return an absolute path string to file targ that is relative to the src file's path. If targ is already absolute, return itself, otherwise expand targ's path. If src cannot be parsed, it is treated as the current location. If src is a file that exists, src is treated as that file's directory. Otherwise src is treated as a directory. (Keep in mind that this resolves targ against the absolute path to src. Also this uses the lexical rules of the file system and the result may not fit in with the actual directory structure.) This may be needed if you are loading files from a configuration file.
      Parameters:
      src - the source file to be referenced
      targ - the target file to construct the absolute path to.
      Returns:
      absolute path to targ

    • dir_absolute_path

      public static String dir_absolute_path(String src)
      Return the absolute path to the referred to directory. If src is an existing readable file, return it's parent directory.
      Parameters:
      src - directory name
      Returns:
      absolute path

    • file_exists

      public static boolean file_exists(String name)
      Determine if the file exists, as a file. Directories (i.e., folders) are not considered files.
      Parameters:
      name - filename, possibly including a path.
      Returns:
      true, it the file exists

    • is_directory

      public static boolean is_directory(String name)
      Determine if a directory exists.
      Parameters:
      name - directory name, possibly including a path.
      Returns:
      true, it the directory exists (and can be read)

    • file_search

      public static String file_search(String fileName, List<String> searchPaths)
      Search for a filename in a list of possible locations. The user must include the current directory in the search if it is desired.
      Parameters:
      fileName - filename to look for, possibly including path
      searchPaths - list of directories to search relative to. If an element refers to a file that exists, then that file's directory will be used.
      Returns:
      string with absolute path to the file found, or null if none found

    • file_search

      public static String file_search(String fileName, String srcFile, String subdir)
      Search for a filename in one of several possible locations:
      • relative to the srcFile,
      • in a subdir relative to srcFile,
      • in a subDir relative to the current dir,
      • in a \scenarios\subDir relative to the current dir, or
      • the current dir.
      Parameters:
      fileName - filename of file one is looking for
      srcFile - source filename
      subdir - sub-directory
      Returns:
      path to filename, or null if not found

    • get_next_filename

      public static String get_next_filename(String name)
      Given a filename (perhaps with a path), return the next filename, that does not already exist. If the files test_1.txt test_2.txt and test_3.txt exist, then get_next_filename("test_1.txt") will return "test_4.txt".
      Parameters:
      name - the candidate file name
      Returns:
      the next file name

    • getFileNames

      public static List<String> getFileNames(String[] names, String extension)
      Given a list of names that may include files or directories, return a list of files that contains (1) all of the files in the original list and (2) all files ending with given extension in directories from the original list.
      Parameters:
      names - a list of names of files or directories
      extension - the extension to search the directory for (include the period, use ".txt" not "txt")
      Returns:
      a list of file names

    • getFileNames

      public static List<String> getFileNames(List<String> names, String extension)
      Given a list of names that may include files or directories, return a list of files that contains (1) all of the files in the original list and (2) all files ending with given extension in directories from the original list.
      Parameters:
      names - a list of names of files or directories
      extension - the extension to search the directory for (include the period, use ".txt" not "txt")
      Returns:
      a list of file names

    • getFileName

      public static List<String> getFileName(String name, String extension)
      Given a name that may be a file or directory, return a list of files that contains (1) the file provided as a parameter or (2) all files ending with the given extension in the directory provided as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of a file or directory
      extension - the extension to search the directory for (include the period, use ".txt" not "txt")
      Returns:
      a list of file names

    • write_persistent

      public static void write_persistent(String configFile, String key, String value)
      Writes a key and value to a file. This can be used for persistence (i.e., when an application starts up, the last file is known). If they key is already in the file, this will rewrite the old value with the new one. If the key is not in the file, this will add the key,value pair to the file
      Parameters:
      configFile - the name of the configuration file
      key - the key
      value - the value

    • write_persistent

      public static void write_persistent(String configFile, ParameterData pd)
      Writes a ParameterData to a file. This can be used for persistence (i.e., when an application starts up, the last file is known).
      Parameters:
      configFile - the name of the configuration file
      pd - ParameterData to write

    • remove_key_persistent

      public static void remove_key_persistent(String configFile, String key)
      Removes a key and its value from file.
      Parameters:
      configFile - the name of the configuration file
      key - the key

    • read_persistent

      public static String read_persistent(String configFile, String key)
      Given a file with a key/value parameter, return the value of the given key. This can be used for persistence (i.e., when an application starts up, the last file is known)
      Parameters:
      configFile - the name of the file to read
      key - the key in the configuration file
      Returns:
      the value of the key, empty string if the key is not found

    • read_persistent

      public static ParameterData read_persistent(String configFile)
      Given a file with one or more key/value pairs, return the ParameterData containing those pairs.
      Parameters:
      configFile -
      Returns:
      parameter database

    • open_PrintWriter

      public static PrintWriter open_PrintWriter(String outFileName)

    • append_file

      public static void append_file(String pathname, List<String> list, String delimiter) throws FileNotFoundException
      Add to the given file a line represented by the list of strings (using UTF-8 character encoding). This method will work even if multiple programs (or multiple threads within the same program) are trying to write to the same file at the same time. If the file is already opened by another thread, then this method will wait until the lock is released, then it will append its line. (Warning: there is a possibility for deadlock).

      For threads within the same program, the guarantee that two threads will not write at the same time is only valid if this method is used. If the file is opened with regular Java IO calls, then there is no guarantee of single access.

      Parameters:
      pathname - the name of the file to append a line (including, possibly, a path)
      list - a list of strings to write to the file
      delimiter - the string to place between each element of the list of string (a comma or a tab character are typical choices)
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened (because it is a directory, etc.)

    • dumpStrToFile

      public static void dumpStrToFile(String outputFileName, String s) throws IOException
      Write the given string to a file with the given name.
      Parameters:
      outputFileName - filename
      s - string
      Throws:
      IOException - if a file error occurs
